message.content:
cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with combinatorial designs and their applications in theoretical computer science, specifically in the area of data storage. The problem of designing families of subsets with small pairwise intersections and label discrepancies is a classic problem in combinatorial design theory, which falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also uses techniques from information theory (cs.IT) to analyze the performance of the proposed designs. The problem of constructing sets with small pairwise intersections is related to the problem of error-correcting codes, which falls under the category of coding theory (cs.CC). The paper also uses probabilistic arguments, which are commonly used in cryptography (cs.CR) and randomized algorithms (cs.DS).
